Extensions/UIColor.html#/s:ZvE17Phase_1_.name: WHITE
Extensions/UIColor.html#/s:ZvE17Phase_1_.abstract: Defined as Isabelline in the color palette. This is the lightest color that is used for most text.

Extensions/UIColor.html#/s:ZvE17Phase_1_.name: CREME
Extensions/UIColor.html#/s:ZvE17Phase_1_.abstract: Defined as Silver Chalice in the color palette. This is the next color after Isabelline and is used as a highlight color for the UINavigationBar as well as heading text (i.e. large text).

Extensions/UIColor.html#/s:ZvE17Phase_1_.name: CHARCOAL
Extensions/UIColor.html#/s:ZvE17Phase_1_.abstract: Defined as Outter Space in the color palette. This is the next color after Silver Chalice and is used as the background color for GeneralUITextField.

Extensions/UIColor.html#/s:ZvE17Phase_1_.name: BACKGROUND
Extensions/UIColor.html#/s:ZvE17Phase_1_.abstract: Defined as Gunmetal in the color palette. This is the next color after Outter Space and is used as the background color for all of the UIViews in UIViewControllers of type GeneralUIViewController.

Extensions/UIColor.html#/s:ZvE17Phase_1_.name: BLACK
Extensions/UIColor.html#/s:ZvE17Phase_1_.abstract: Defined as Raisin Black in the color palette. This is the next color after Gunmetal and is used as the text color GeneralUILabel found on light backgrounds or more particularly for the LoginButton found on the main page of this application.

Extensions/UIColor.html#/s:ZvE17Phase_1_.name: RED
Extensions/UIColor.html#/s:ZvE17Phase_1_.abstract: Defined as Light Red Ochire in the color palette. This color replaces all Red in the application. It can be used as a GeneralUIButton color, or UIView. This can be seen in the NoiseMeter where this color indicates the loudest audio decibal range.

Extensions/UIColor.html#/s:ZvE17Phase_1_.name: GREEN
Extensions/UIColor.html#/s:ZvE17Phase_1_.abstract: Defined as Very Light Malachite Green in the color palette. This color replaces all Green in the application. It can be used as a GeneralUIButton color, or UIView. This can be seen in the NoiseMeter where this color indicates an audio decibal range.

Extensions/UIColor.html#/s:ZvE17Phase_1_.name: PURPLE
Extensions/UIColor.html#/s:ZvE17Phase_1_.abstract: Defined as Pale Violet in the color palette. This color replaces all Purple in the application. It can be used as a GeneralUIButton color, or UIView. This can be seen in the NoiseMeter where this color indicates an audio decibal range.

Extensions/UIColor.html#/s:ZvE17Phase_1_.name: BLUE
Extensions/UIColor.html#/s:ZvE17Phase_1_.abstract: Defined as Maya Blue in the color palette. This color replaces all Blue in the application. It can be used as a GeneralUIButton color, or UIView. This can be seen in the NoiseMeter where this color indicates an audio decibal range.

Extensions/UIColor.html#/s:ZvE17Phase_1_.name: ORANGE
Extensions/UIColor.html#/s:ZvE17Phase_1_.abstract: Defined as Macaroni and Cheese in the color palette. This color replaces all Orange in the application. It can be used as a GeneralUIButton color, or UIView. This can be seen in the NoiseMeter where this color indicates an audio decibal range.

Extensions/UIColor.html#/s:ZvE17Phase_1_.name: FB_BLUE
Extensions/UIColor.html#/s:ZvE17Phase_1_.abstract: This is the official color designated by Facebook as their Facebook-Blue. This color was used as the background for the custom Facebook GeneralUIButton that shows up on the Login and Create Account ViewControllers

Extensions/UIColor.html#/s:ZvE17Phase_1_.name: GOOGLE_RED
Extensions/UIColor.html#/s:ZvE17Phase_1_.abstract: This is the official color designated by Google as their Google-Red. This color was used as the background for the custom Google GeneralUIButton that shows up on the Login and Create Account ViewControllers

Extensions/UINavigationBar.html#/s:FE17P.name: setBottomBorderColor(color:height:)
Extensions/UINavigationBar.html#/s:FE17P.abstract: Creates a ‘bottom border’ for the UINavigationBar by creating a new UIView of height height (@param), setting its background color to color (@param) adding it as a subview.

Extensions/UIFont.html#/s:ZvE17Phase_1_W.name: BUTTON
Extensions/UIFont.html#/s:ZvE17Phase_1_W.abstract: This is the default font that is used by GeneralUIButton objects.

Extensions/UIFont.html#/s:ZvE17Phase_1_W.name: LABEL
Extensions/UIFont.html#/s:ZvE17Phase_1_W.abstract: This is the default font that is used by GeneralUILabel objects.

Extensions/UIFont.html#/s:ZvE17Phase_1_W.name: TEXTFIELD
Extensions/UIFont.html#/s:ZvE17Phase_1_W.abstract: This is the default font that is used by GeneralUITextField objects.

Extensions/UIFont.html#/s:ZvE17Phase_1_W.name: LOGO
Extensions/UIFont.html#/s:ZvE17Phase_1_W.abstract: This is the font that is used by text that appears under the logo on the InitialViewController

Extensions/UIFont.html#/s:ZvE17Phase_1_W.name: LARGE
Extensions/UIFont.html#/s:ZvE17Phase_1_W.abstract: This is the font that is used by NoiseMeterViewController to display the Noise Level in Decibels.

Extensions/UIFont.html#/s:ZvE17Phase_1_W.name: CAPTION
Extensions/UIFont.html#/s:ZvE17Phase_1_W.abstract: This is the font that is used by NoiseMeterViewController to caption the different colors in the Noise Meter.

Classes/GeneralUIButton.html#/s:FC17Phas.name: awakeFromNib()
Classes/GeneralUIButton.html#/s:FC17Phas.abstract: Customize appearance of the UIButton object when this function is called. The theme enforces the cornerRadius, backgroundColor, titleColor, and titleLabelFont to be consistent among all GeneralUIButton objects.

Classes/GeneralUIViewController.html#/s:.name: viewDidLoad()
Classes/GeneralUIViewController.html#/s:.abstract: Customize appearance of the UIViewController object when this function is called. The theme enforces the background color as well as the appearance of the navigationController by calling setBottomBorderColor with color (@param) set to UIColor.CREME and height (@param) set to 0.25. Finally it creates a new UIBarButtonItem such that the Back Button shows only an arrow to signifiy return.

Classes/NoiseMeterViewController.html#/s.name: noiseLevelLabel
Classes/NoiseMeterViewController.html#/s.abstract: A dynamic GeneralUILabel that displays the Noise Level

Classes/NoiseMeterViewController.html#/s.name: dbLabel
Classes/NoiseMeterViewController.html#/s.abstract: A static GeneralUILabel that displays the dB Unit

Classes/NoiseMeterViewController.html#/s.name: silentLabel
Classes/NoiseMeterViewController.html#/s.abstract: A static GeneralUILabel that captions the silent UIView

Classes/NoiseMeterViewController.html#/s.name: quietLabel
Classes/NoiseMeterViewController.html#/s.abstract: A static GeneralUILabel that captions the quiet UIView

Classes/NoiseMeterViewController.html#/s.name: averageLabel
Classes/NoiseMeterViewController.html#/s.abstract: A static GeneralUILabel that captions the average UIView

Classes/NoiseMeterViewController.html#/s.name: noisyLabel
Classes/NoiseMeterViewController.html#/s.abstract: A static GeneralUILabel that captions the noisy UIView

Classes/NoiseMeterViewController.html#/s.name: loudLabel
Classes/NoiseMeterViewController.html#/s.abstract: A static GeneralUILabel that captions the loud UIView

Classes/NoiseMeterViewController.html#/s.name: noiseMeterViewOne
Classes/NoiseMeterViewController.html#/s.abstract: A static UIView that is colored UIColor.BLUE to represent the ‘silent’ noise range

Classes/NoiseMeterViewController.html#/s.name: noiseMeterViewTwo
Classes/NoiseMeterViewController.html#/s.abstract: A static UIView that is colored UIColor.GREEN to represent the ‘quiet’ noise range

Classes/NoiseMeterViewController.html#/s.name: noiseMeterViewThree
Classes/NoiseMeterViewController.html#/s.abstract: A static UIView that is colored UIColor.PURPLE to represent the ‘average’ noise range

Classes/NoiseMeterViewController.html#/s.name: noiseMeterViewFour
Classes/NoiseMeterViewController.html#/s.abstract: A static UIView that is colored UIColor.ORANGE to represent the ‘noisy’ noise range

Classes/NoiseMeterViewController.html#/s.name: noiseMeterViewFive
Classes/NoiseMeterViewController.html#/s.abstract: A static UIView that is colored UIColor.RED to represent the ‘loud’ noise range

Classes/NoiseMeterViewController.html#/s.name: recorder
Classes/NoiseMeterViewController.html#/s.abstract: The recorder object on which the noise meter relies.

Classes/NoiseMeterViewController.html#/s.name: levelTimer
Classes/NoiseMeterViewController.html#/s.abstract: A timer object to gathers noise data frequently.

Classes/NoiseMeterViewController.html#/s.name: dBs
Classes/NoiseMeterViewController.html#/s.abstract: An array to store the recorded noise levels, this can be used to display a history graph of the past noise levels.

Classes/NoiseMeterViewController.html#/s.name: viewDidLoad()
Classes/NoiseMeterViewController.html#/s.abstract: This function sets up custom UI Elements specific to this view then calls setupAVAudioSession to set up the audio session that measures noise.

Classes/NoiseMeterViewController.html#/s.name: setupAVAudioSession()
Classes/NoiseMeterViewController.html#/s.abstract: Creates an AVAudioSession as a sharedInstance then requests recording permission from the user. If the user allows recording, the AVAudioSession has settings changed and the record method is called.

Classes/NoiseMeterViewController.html#/s.name: record(filename:settings:metered:timeIntervalForResults:)
Classes/NoiseMeterViewController.html#/s.abstract: A function that allows the recorder to record storing the file at filename (@param), with settings settings (@param), a flag to determine if the recording should be metered, and a timeInterval for levelTimer.

Classes/NoiseMeterViewController.html#/s.name: levelTimerCallback()
Classes/NoiseMeterViewController.html#/s.abstract: The callback function for levelTimer. This allows the view to be updated with the new noise levels: recorder calls updateMeters and updateLabels is called to update the view.

Classes/NoiseMeterViewController.html#/s.name: updateLabels(dB:)
Classes/NoiseMeterViewController.html#/s.abstract: This function changes the text in the noiseLevelLabel and sets the color of the text based on the NoiseMeterColors.

Classes/NoiseMeterViewController.html#/s.name: convertToDecibel(originalValue:)
Classes/NoiseMeterViewController.html#/s.abstract: Converts from Apple standard noise levels to the universally used decibel system. Changes values from a linear [-160, 0] scale to a logrithmic [0, 120] scale.

Classes/NoiseMeterViewController.html#/s.name: setupNoiseMeter()
Classes/NoiseMeterViewController.html#/s.abstract: This function sets up the different small UIViews that create the NoiseMeter at the top of this UIView. Also sets the font for the labels that describe each color of the meter.

Classes/NoiseMeterViewController.html#/s.name: audioRecorderDidFinishRecording(_:successfully:)
Classes/NoiseMeterViewController.html#/s.abstract: Ensures that when the recording ends a sucess or failure flag is sent to recordingEnded function.

Classes/NoiseMeterViewController.html#/s.name: recordingEnded(success:)
Classes/NoiseMeterViewController.html#/s.abstract: Prints whether or not the recording session ended correctly.

Classes/GeneralUITextField.html#/s:FC17P.name: awakeFromNib()
Classes/GeneralUITextField.html#/s:FC17P.abstract: Customize appearance of the UITextField object when this function is called. The theme enforces the background, placeholder text, and typed in text colors. Furthermore, a specific font is applied to the text that appears in this UITextField. Background Color is set to UIColor.CHARCOAL. Placeholder Text Color is set to UIColor.CREME. Text Color is set to UIColor.WHITE. Font is set to UIFont.TEXTFIELD. This will ensure that all GeneralUITextField objects will have the same appearance.

Classes/GeneralUITableView.html#/s:FC17P.name: awakeFromNib()
Classes/GeneralUITableView.html#/s:FC17P.abstract: Customize appearance of the UITableView object when this function is called. The theme enforces the seperatorStyle, estimatedRowHeight, allowsSelection and backgroundColor to be consistent among all GeneralUITableView objects.

Classes/RecorderViewController.html#/s:v.name: recordingLabel
Classes/RecorderViewController.html#/s:v.abstract: The GeneralUILabel that displays if in record mode.

Classes/RecorderViewController.html#/s:v.name: state
Classes/RecorderViewController.html#/s:v.abstract: The state of the recorder -> true if recording, false if paused or stopped.

Classes/RecorderViewController.html#/s:v.name: recorder
Classes/RecorderViewController.html#/s:v.abstract: The `AVAudioRecorder’ that performs recording from the microphone.

Classes/RecorderViewController.html#/s:v.name: recordedAudio
Classes/RecorderViewController.html#/s:v.abstract: The `RecordedAudioObject’ object to store information of the user’s recording.

Classes/RecorderViewController.html#/s:F.name: viewWillAppear(_:)
Classes/RecorderViewController.html#/s:F.abstract: Hide stopButton and recordingLabel. This must be done since the user should not be able to stop the recording before it even starts.

Classes/RecorderViewController.html#/s:F.name: viewDidLoad()
Classes/RecorderViewController.html#/s:F.abstract: Set the state and font of the recordingLabel. Call setupAVAudioSession to initiate the recording process.

Classes/RecorderViewController.html#/s:F.name: prepare(for:sender:)
Classes/RecorderViewController.html#/s:F.abstract: Overridden to send RecordedAudioObject to the next GeneralUIViewController that we are seguing to. In this case the only possible segue is to EqualizerViewController.

Classes/RecorderViewController.html#/s:F.name: setupAVAudioSession()
Classes/RecorderViewController.html#/s:F.abstract: Creates an AVAudioSession as a sharedInstance then requests recording permission from the user. If the user allows recording, the AVAudioSession has settings changed and the record method is called.

Classes/RecorderViewController.html#/s:F.name: record(filename:settings:metered:timeIntervalForResults:)
Classes/RecorderViewController.html#/s:F.abstract: A function that allows the recorder to record storing the file at filename (@param), with settings settings (@param), a flag to determine if the recording should be metered, and a timeInterval for levelTimer.

Classes/RecorderViewController.html#/s:F.name: audioRecorderDidFinishRecording(_:successfully:)
Classes/RecorderViewController.html#/s:F.abstract: Ensures that when the recording ends a sucess or failure flag is sent to recordingEnded function.

Classes/RecorderViewController.html#/s:F.name: recordingEnded(success:)
Classes/RecorderViewController.html#/s:F.abstract: If the recording succeeded store the URL of the recorded clip then call performeSegue. Else notify the user that recording failed.

Classes/RecorderViewController.html#/s:F.name: toggleRecording(_:)
Classes/RecorderViewController.html#/s:F.abstract: Toggle the state - this function handles the logic of switching the state. Hiding and unhiding different views.

Classes/GeneralUILabel.html#/s:FC17Phase.name: awakeFromNib()
Classes/GeneralUILabel.html#/s:FC17Phase.abstract: Customize appearance of the UILabel object when this function is called. The theme enforces the text color and font. This will ensure that all GeneralUILabel objects will have the same appearance.

Classes/GeneralUITableViewCell.html#/s:F.name: awakeFromNib()
Classes/GeneralUITableViewCell.html#/s:F.abstract: Customize appearance of the UITableViewCell object when this function is called. The theme enforces the backgroundColor to be consistent among all GeneralUITableViewCell objects.

Classes/EqualizerViewController.html#/s:.name: viewDidLoad()
Classes/EqualizerViewController.html#/s:.abstract: Check if user recorded clip or if they want to use real-time recording. If a clip was recorded, setupAudioPlayer and setupAudioEngine are called consequently.

Classes/EqualizerViewController.html#/s:.name: setupAudioEngine()
Classes/EqualizerViewController.html#/s:.abstract: This function creates an AVAudioEngine stored in audioEngine. It next creates an AVAudioPlayerNode and attaches it to audioEngine. Finally equalizer is initialized to AVAudioUnitEQ with 14 bands.

Classes/GeneralUITableViewCell.html.name: GeneralUITableViewCell
Classes/GeneralUITableViewCell.html.abstract: This type was created to ensure that all of the UITableViewCell objects are created consistently. This class allows the developer to easily apply a ‘theme’ across all of the GeneralUITableViewCell objects

Classes/GeneralUILabel.html.name: GeneralUILabel
Classes/GeneralUILabel.html.abstract: This type was created to ensure that all of the UILabel objects are created consistently. This class allows the developer to easily apply a ‘theme’ across all of the GeneralUILabel objects

Classes/GeneralUITableView.html.name: GeneralUITableView
Classes/GeneralUITableView.html.abstract: This type was created to ensure that all of the UITableView objects are created consistently. This class allows the developer to easily apply a ‘theme’ across all of the GeneralUITableView objects

Classes/GeneralUITextField.html.name: GeneralUITextField
Classes/GeneralUITextField.html.abstract: This type was created to ensure that all of the UITextField objects are created consistently. This class allows the developer to easily apply a ‘theme’ across all of the GeneralUITextField objects

Classes/NoiseMeterViewController.html.name: NoiseMeterViewController
Classes/NoiseMeterViewController.html.abstract: A custom class that inherits from GeneralUIViewController and AVAudioRecorderDelegate. It was created to control the NoiseMeterView.

Classes/GeneralUIViewController.html.name: GeneralUIViewController
Classes/GeneralUIViewController.html.abstract: This type was created to ensure that all of the UIViewController objects are created consistently. This class allows the developer to easily apply a ‘theme’ across all of the GeneralUIViewController objects

Classes/GeneralUIButton.html.name: GeneralUIButton
Classes/GeneralUIButton.html.abstract: This type was created to ensure that all of the UIButton objects are created consistently. This class allows the developer to easily apply a ‘theme’ across all of the GeneralUIButton objects
